meanings.definition: Having a particular form or structure
meanings.sent1: The artist created a morphic sculpture out of clay.
meanings.sent2: The building had a unique morphic design that stood out in the city.
meanings.sent3: The morphic clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts took on a morphic quality, shifting and changing constantly.
meanings.sent5: The morphic pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by a particular form or structure
meanings.sent1: The architect discussed the morphic elements of the building's design.
meanings.sent2: The book described a world with morphic landscapes and creatures.
meanings.sent3: The morphic shapes on the wallpaper seemed to dance in the light.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a morphic rhythm, rising and falling like waves.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of morphic beauty in nature.

meanings.definition: Capable of assuming different forms or shapes
meanings.sent1: The creature in the movie was a morphic being, changing its appearance at will.
meanings.sent2: The material had morphic properties, allowing it to stretch and mold easily.
meanings.sent3: The toy transformed into various morphic figures, delighting the children.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with morphic images, shifting from scene to scene.
meanings.sent5: The superhero possessed a morphic suit that adapted to any situation.
